result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas N Lacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Community Service earnings to be applied to all costs.  Balance of $43.00 to be paid by 02-17-2017.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders 2 days in the Waukesha County Jail.  2 days credit.  Time served.

Perform 40 hours of community service at $10.00 per hour to offset court costs/DNA surcharge. To be completed within one year (02-17-2017).  Balance of $43.00 to be paid to Clerk of Courts.  Defendant to provide proof of completion prior to due date.  To be monitored by WCS.

2/20/2017 - COURT GRANTS 3 MONTH EXTENSION TO COMPLETE COMMUNITY SERVICE.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas N Lacy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Vacating Civil Judgment signed by Judge Aprahamian on July 17, 2017.
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Thomas N Lacy in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant makes statements as to the Community Service he completed and indicates he completed 40 hours.   Court deems the community service satisfied.

6/22/17 - Per Judge,  $43.00 balance to be converted to a civil judgment.
Review hearing on June 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on June 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.

From WCS dated 5/16/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 5/20/17; Have WCS obtain affidavit from Mr. Lacy regarding specific details of the service he provided.
**Per Judge Aprahamian 5/24/17; Schedule hearing**

From WCS dated 2/16/17 re hours could not be verified and defendant would like additional time granted to complete remaining hours of community service.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 2/17/17; Three month extension granted.  Notify WCS and defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas N Lacy in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.   The Defendant is sentenced as follows:
 
Count #1:

JAIL:  2 days, apply Credit - 2 days. (TIME SERVED).

COSTS: $243.00 (apply community service earnnings and balance to be paid by 2/17/17); 

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid by 2/17/17.   (apply community service earnnings and balance to be paid by 2/17/17). Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COMMUNITY SERVICE: Perform 40 hours Community Service dealing with law enforcement to be completed by 2/17/17 @ a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the costs of the fine/costs.   The Community service is to be monitored by WCS.

Defendant Thomas N Lacy in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
